name: Vegan Roasted Chile Poblano Soup
description: Potato stands in for cream in this vegan soup to make it rich and wonderful.
recipeIngredient: 3 medium Poblano chiles (about 4 to 5 inches long)

recipeInstructions.text: Roast and clean the poblano chiles
recipeInstructions.name: Roast and clean the poblano chiles

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the poblano chile, potato and onion
recipeInstructions.name: Chop the poblano chile, potato and onion

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the cooking oil in a pot to medium heat
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the cooking oil in a pot to medium heat

recipeInstructions.text: To the pot add the onion and garlic and sauté until the onion starts to turn translucent (about 5 minutes). Stir frequently
recipeInstructions.name: To the pot add the onion and garlic and sauté until the onion starts to turn translucent (about 5 minutes). Stir frequently

recipeInstructions.text: Add the potato and continue cooking for another 5 minutes
recipeInstructions.name: Add the potato and continue cooking for another 5 minutes

recipeInstructions.text: Add the chiles and ½ of the white corn
recipeInstructions.name: Add the chiles and ½ of the white corn

recipeInstructions.text: Add 5 cups of water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and cook for 20 minutes
recipeInstructions.name: Add 5 cups of water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and cook for 20 minutes

recipeInstructions.text: In 2 batches, blend the soup until very smooth (about 2 minutes per batch)
recipeInstructions.name: In 2 batches, blend the soup until very smooth (about 2 minutes per batch)

recipeInstructions.text: Return the soup to the pot and simmer for 20 more minutes
recipeInstructions.name: Return the soup to the pot and simmer for 20 more minutes

recipeInstructions.text: If the soup is too thick, add the remaining cup of water a little bit at a time until the desired consistency is reached.
recipeInstructions.name: If the soup is too thick, add the remaining cup of water a little bit at a time until the desired consistency is reached.

itemListElement.text: Cut the corn tortillas in half and then slice into ¼ inch wide strips
itemListElement.name: Cut the corn tortillas in half and then slice into ¼ inch wide strips

itemListElement.text: Preheat ¼ inch of cooking oil in a frying pan to medium hot
itemListElement.name: Preheat ¼ inch of cooking oil in a frying pan to medium hot

itemListElement.text: Tip: To check to see if the oil is ready, drop 1 tortilla strip into the oil. If the oil starts to bubble the oil is ready
itemListElement.name: Tip: To check to see if the oil is ready, drop 1 tortilla strip into the oil. If the oil starts to bubble the oil is ready

itemListElement.text: Place the tortilla strips into the hot oil
itemListElement.name: Place the tortilla strips into the hot oil

itemListElement.text: Every 30 seconds stir the tortilla strips so that they cook evenly
itemListElement.name: Every 30 seconds stir the tortilla strips so that they cook evenly

itemListElement.text: When the tortilla strips have turned Golden Brown they are done
itemListElement.name: When the tortilla strips have turned Golden Brown they are done

itemListElement.text: Drain the tortilla strips on paper towels
itemListElement.name: Drain the tortilla strips on paper towels

itemListElement.text: Heat the reserved corn in the microwave for 45 seconds
itemListElement.name: Heat the reserved corn in the microwave for 45 seconds

itemListElement.text: Garnish the soup with tortilla strips and 2 spoonfuls of corn
itemListElement.name: Garnish the soup with tortilla strips and 2 spoonfuls of corn

keywords: creamy poblano soup, vegan poblano soup, vegan roasted chile soup
